info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 8:23PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jones, Shackelford and southeastern Throckmorton Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 823 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albany, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albany, Lueders, Woodson, Fort Griffin, Ibex, Mccarty Lake, Lusk, Big Country Baptist Assembly, The Intersection Of Us-183 And Us- 283, The Intersection Of Us-283 And Ranch Road 209 and Us- 180 Near The Shackelford-Stephens County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
